subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: thoughts on Shavian/Quikscript unification
msgSnippet: ... Can t hurt, might help. -- John Cowan   cowan@ccil.org    http://ccil.org/~cowan The known is finite, the unknown infinite; intellectually we stand on an
messageBody:
Nathan Sharfi scripsit:

> Would it help clarify my position to the UTC and any other
> interested party if I were to prepare a page in the style of
> <http://www.evertype.com/standards/cy/coptic.html> that highlights the
> differences between Quikscript and Shavian? This would be in addition
> to my more interactive page, of course.

Can't hurt, might help.

--
John Cowan cowan@... http://ccil.org/~cowan
The known is finite, the unknown infinite; intellectually we stand
on an islet in the midst of an illimitable ocean of inexplicability.
Our business in every generation is to reclaim a little more land,
to add something to the extent and the solidity of our possessions.
--Thomas Henry Huxley
